cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 15 mi (25 km) south of Cayo Largo, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving WNW, forecast to turn NW then NNW and track across the central-northwest Gulf toward the Texas–Louisiana coastline
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the TX/LA border between Port Arthur, TX and Lake Charles, LA

weather_observation.impacted_coast: northwest Gulf Coast from eastern Texas through southwest Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–73 mph) are possible at Houston with a 36 % chance; hurricane-force gusts cannot be ruled out if the track shifts westward.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential life-threatening storm surge above 3 ft is possible along the upper Texas coast and within Galveston Bay if Laura tracks nearer the coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain with isolated totals to 12 inches are possible Wednesday night–Thursday, producing flash-flood and urban-flood concerns for the Houston area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes and dangerous rip currents are possible as bands move onshore.
